description: In 1984, Windsor city council unanimously refused to declare Gay Awareness Week following a presentation by Dr. Robert McGirr and Dr. Walter Percival who claimed it would “display sexual activities in front of children” and “promote a way of life that spreads a lethal disease.” CBC Windsor then refused a public service announcement about Gay Awareness Week, and the Lesbian/Gay Community Service Group filed unsuccessful complaints with the CBC and the Health Disciplines Board of Ontario.
